Reviews.Title: “Great location, average to small rooms, reasonable parking”
Reviews.Author: trvlr7311
Reviews.Content: Great location on the north edge of downtown, near Belltown, easy acces to I-5 in either direction. Breakfasts comes with the room. Parking is $10 for underground. Unfortunately they frequently oversell the parking garage and have an overflow surface lot. They do reduce the charge to $5, still cheap for Seattle, but it's a bit of a hassle to discover the garage is full. Typical HIE, hot breakfast. Small pool, decent exercise room. Great access to 99 North. Walking distance to all kinds of downtown shops/restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again because of value, location, and quality”
Reviews.Author: lornegrant
Reviews.Content: this is an above average hotel - a typical holiday inn express but better than most. The location is great and very close to the space needle and downtown. Getting here is easy and I'd stay again next time I visit. The staff were friendly and made my stay more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “St Patrick's day in the Emerald City (Seattle)”
Reviews.Author: George M
Reviews.Content: I came on a package from Clipper Vacation special, Hotel was walking distance to everything. All though I got a bit disoriented and due to the construction at the front meant that I had to run across the highway (Although my smart wife tells me there was a crosswalk). There is a back way through another hotel. Breakfast was good, really enjoyed the eggs. I think I had one of the only rooms in Seattle where you couldn't view the Space Needle, but I could see it from the small but nice pool. Staff was helpfull, assisting my smart wife with directions and advice on where to get President Obama's, and the First Lady's favourite chocolate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hotelgalvancouver
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed in November, but in looking for another hotel on this site, realized that I should have written a review, as it was such a great stay. The rooms were well appointed, the staff were outstanding, and the hot breakfast added even more to the great value of staying at this hotel. The location is outstanding, making downtown Seattle a great walking destination. The parking was easy to use and reasonably priced. Really - I'll return again and again to this location when travelling to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Thank you.”
Reviews.Author: Nefffamily
Reviews.Content: I left a review about being told I would get one room then didn't get what I was told. The manger called me and totally made it up to my family. Thank you sooo much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TahoeMother
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel in a great location. We could see the Space Needle out our window - we were only a few blocks away. There is a monorail you can catch at the Space Needle to take you downtown. We did not use this option so I don't know how much it cost but the convenience is great considering parking in the downtown area can be hard to come by and expensive. It was also easy to get on and off the freeway. The bathroom shower was perfect in my opinion - I can't stand a stream with no strength and this one was great. The breakfast and free internet were much appreciated and certainly helped with our expenses on this trip. Parking was fairly easy although there was one night where we got the very last spot so I am not sure what would have happened if we had returned any later. There were also a few spaces that looked like they would be pretty tight to get into. Probably the biggest negative was the noise we could hear from the busy road outside. This was probably worse for us as we were on the second floor and right on the road - a higher floor or a room on the other side (the alley side) might be quieter. I am not sure if were given this room specifically because we purchased the room through Hotwire - sometimes I think the worst rooms are given to Hotwire clients since they are paying less. We may have noticed it more because we live in a very quiet area where there is virtually no noise outside at night. The breakfast could be better but I have also seen much worse. I would like to see them label the offerings each day - there were 2 different days that omelets were offered but it was not clear what was in them. There was a sign in the elevator but we took the stairs each day because the wait for the elevator could be pretty long and we were only on the 2nd floor. The room was comfortable - we had a queen and a sleeper sofa, a refrigerator, and a microwave. The biggest issue was that when the sleeper was pulled out (which for us was the whole time) there was no room for the chair to be moved around at the desk. I solved this by moving the whole desk closer to the TV.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for and then some.”
Reviews.Author: wicketo
Reviews.Content: Pretty much got what I expected from a holiday inn express. The hotel seems to me to be a little on the old side, but it's not too bad and the hotel made up for it by a number of factors: Price was good at 80 $ plus. I got upgraded to a spa suite with a nice big bath tub in recognition of my platin status, I guess. So I had a room with a lot of space and a nice sitting area, as well as a small kitchen. The location is pretty good for a budget hotel. A brisk ten-minute-walk gets you smack into the city center and to the delightfull pikes place market. You get a view of the space needle, which is especially nice at night if, like me, you don't mind a bit of traffic noise - not much, though. Breakfast was also quite good, in a comfortable room, and I always appreciate the 24h free coffee. Should I get back to Seattle on a budget, I will certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 123terracotta
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in Feb at this hotel and I must say when I booked and then looked up the comments I was a little hesitant, there seemed a lot of negative comments. However, please disregard most of those, We found this hotel clean, comfy, the staff going over the top to help us with finding places to eat, help us out in any way possible. The "free" breakfast is very good and lots of varieties. Not sure how any one can complain about that. If you do not have your laptop with you they have computers ready for you to use, no cost either. We will certainly be back and have no hesitations to recommend this hotel to any one who is interested, disregard the complainers , no doubt not much will please them on any given day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, food, value, service -- but tired”
Reviews.Author: srs-seattle
Reviews.Content: Technically I want to give it a 3.5 rating. We'd scored a really great deal on a discount-booking site, so when I called ahead to choose a king bed, I didn't expect they'd feel the need to extend much kindness to us, but they were fantastic. They made sure we had a non-smoking room, too. (There are still smoking rooms in Seattle??) Front-desk staff were super-friendly, and free wi-fi always earns my gratitude. The free morning breakfast had tons of options; the only downside was that on a weekend morning, jockeying for tables and toast was actually getting a little contentious. But that is more a commentary on the clientele than on the hotel. Our bathroom door was made of a cheap material and looked pretty worn out, but the room was clean and the bed was really comfortable. It's a three-minute walk to the Space Needle and EMP, so if you don't mind walking fifteen minutes (ten flat blocks) to the shopping district and the Market, it's worth the savings. West-facing rooms have really great views, too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect price and location”
Reviews.Author: scottyth
Reviews.Content: A great hotel only a few blocks from the Seattle space needle, and within walking distance to my destination, rendezvous and the jewel boc theater. Stayed in room 405, checked ou on jan. 29th.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to Seattle Center, but otherwise just average”
Reviews.Author: OregonTraveler1180
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property primarily for its location to the Seattle Center. During our stay we also rode the Monorail to Westlake and the downtown shopping, and then walked back to the hotel. We have stayed at many Holiday Inn Express in our travels around the country, and I would say this property is less than the normal experience. The property is older and is definitely showing wear and tear. New carpet and paint are needed. Room is smaller but clean.The staff were not overly friendly, but did take care of requests, etc in a timely manner. The breakfast was the typical Holiday Inn Express menu but they have definitely trimmed some items ...reducing costs? As Priority Club members we prefer to stay within the Holiday Inn brand, therefore our next trip to Seattle downtown area we will return to staying at the Crowne Plaza Hotel. More expensive but excellant staff, service, but unfortunately no comp breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Overall OK - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: walls2009
Reviews.Content: Not my usual choice of hotel or even hotel class, as this was an atypical trip I took where budget trumped all else (got a two-queen room with free wi-fi and breakfast for less than $65/nt which can't be beat given the circumstances). Location is OK at best, though really depends on why you're in Seattle and what you want to do. It is located on a rather busy and grimy street but if that's not an issue, Seattle City Center is just a block away and Belltown/Downtown is a 10-15 walk or shorter bus ride in. If you have a car and need to get around, driving to I-5 or other major arteries seems easy. The room was clean, as were the rest of the premises. "Fitness room" really just consists of five outdated cardio machines and a treadmill, and the pool is really only usable if no more than 3 people are in it (or say, 4-6 little kids which, on this trip, were the primary users). Great for 1-2 night business travel, or perhaps a short vacation for young families traveling on a tight budget. Breakfast could really benefit from some fresh fruit, but then again it's there and free if you want it...mostly biscuits, eggs and a meat microwaved in bulk. There is yogurt, instant oatmeal, and some other assorted pastries available as well. I believe overnight parking is $10/nt though we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, fabulous view and we walked to Pike Place and the Victoria Clipper!”
Reviews.Author: Schlarbie
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful find in downtown Seattle! Free wi-fi and breakfast and a breath-taking view of the Space Needle! And an enthusiastic and greatful nod to Cassidy at the front desk who was especially nice and helpful. We walked to both the Market and Pier 69, which took about 20 minutes and might be a bit long for little ones...cabs and cars were also available for $10 or less. Westlake Center was also walkable and their foodcourt was ideal for our limited budget and completely opposite cravings for dinner (my daughter had "the BEST" fettucini alfredo and I had a gyro). Great staff, good location, and all the amenities of Holiday Inn Express!

Reviews.Title: “Will not choose holiday inn again.”
Reviews.Author: Hairdresser05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel visiting my boyfriend in the military for new years. My first night the room and service was perfect. The second night we were moved into a smoking room that gave me a terrible headache and made my clothes smell like an ash tray. I understood it was NYE and they could not change my room, however, mathew smith who works the front service desk was rude in the manor and smarted off to another employee about me as I walked away from our conversation of not being able to change rooms. He told me there wasn't a manager I could talk to and the holiday inn does not have a cooperate phone number. I have never been treated with such disrespect and be littleness. I will not visit here again.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Space Needle and downtown”
Reviews.Author: wosli3
Reviews.Content: In town for a conference and was willing to walk to save a little money. This place fit the bill. Clean, decent breakfast, helpful staff and free Internet. The only problem is half the rooms overlook Hiway 99. Constant traffic noise 24/7. Ask for a room on the other side. Easy walk to good restaurants and the Pike Market.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: CB0911
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, rooms are a little dated but the beds were super comfy and the black out blinds were a big plus! Found it a bit strange having the sink in the bedroom opposed to the bathroom. Wasn't that big of a deal though. TV/ TV Remote was a little delayed- but again not a big deal. Breakfast was average but got the day off to a good start. Space needle is very close by which is beside the monorail to bring you downtown. Parking was secure but had to have room keys on you at all times to get in. An intercom would be ideal. Nice restaurant down the ally which was cheap and convenient. After a long day of traveling all we wanted was to get into bed and after having our credit card maxed out by the car rental cash deposits were not an option. Had to transfer money through one of the computers in the business center- wasn't ideal but we didn't care. Overall the service is good and we enjoyed our city break. Would we stay in this holiday inn express again? Depending on price.

Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: 401mdd
Reviews.Content: i thought this place was great because there's an inside pool and gym. It was very close to the city and I enjoyed my stay there. On top of that there was a complimentary breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: HurdleQueen03
Reviews.Content: Clean room, within walking distance of everything we wanted to see including FREE buses taking you to other side of town, and friendly as well as very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: john l
Reviews.Content: What a great time we had while staying at this motel. The location to the Space Needle was unbeatable, only about 4 blocks away, although have to walk up the street before heading over-no crossover for the road. From there, caught the monorail to mall downtown, and walked to the pier, aquarium, Pike's Place Market, and water front. It is a good walk from the mall to the water front, so be prepared for that, but definitely not a death march. The motel has a very nice pool, good parking area, but spaces are small (no real suprise there). The only downside of this motel would be lack of places to eat nearby. Rooms were very wel appointed and comfortable, very nice lobby, and the breakfast was excellent every morning. The menu changed everyday, so nothing got tiresome to eat, good sized room, only at peak of rush was it hard to find a table.

Reviews.Title: “very clean, great staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: blaze_bc
Reviews.Content: If this was the express hotel i can't even imagine what the regular hotel looks like. We were greeted by Terra at the front desk when we arrived off the clipper. She was so friendly, there was a bit of a line up when we arrived but she greeted us soon as we walked into the lobby so we didn't mind waiting at all. Terra was so helpful on telling us things to do in Seattle and answering all our question about the city. They are lucky to have such an attentive and knowledgeable desk clerk if you can't tell all ready she really made our stay special. The room was amazing we had a view of the mountains and the space needle. It was little noisy but not to bad, so as other travelers have said if you want quite go for the back of the hotel. The room was just spotless, one of the cleanest i have seen. Location i thought was great it was close to the space needle, EMP and science fiction museum and the duck ride. By the space needle you will find the mono rail that gets you downtown in like 5 minutes for $2.25 then it's a 10 minute walk to Pike place market. I've been to Seattle in the past and stayed at a different hotel but I will be back to the Holiday Inn for sure next time Iâ€™m in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to the space needle”
Reviews.Author: jamwo212
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fair. It was were close to the space needle. If traveling on aurora ave, it is quite hard to get to

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the Space needle”
Reviews.Author: Gandrewz
Reviews.Content: The front of this hotel offers very good views of the space needle which is about 10 mins walk away, from the needle access to the rest of the city is fairly easy using the monorail and free bus service. Rooms are very spacious and our rooms had the added bonus of a jacuzzi. However rooms with a view of the needle front onto a very busy, noisy road, so if this is a problem for you, you will have to sacrifce the view and ask for a room at the back of the hotel. This hotel backs onto a Holiday Inn which has the nearest restaurant to the express, however the menu in this restaurant is very limited. Internet is free. Parking is charged at $10 per night, a room card is required to access the parking so check in first. The breakfast is standard holiday inn express fare, but the breakfast room gets very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Location Is It's Saving Grace”
Reviews.Author: Robert T
Reviews.Content: Located close to the Space Needle & MusicExperience with the monorail station in there. Unfortunately the smallish room was located next door to a TV Station which had a helipad on it's roof. Not good being woken @ around 5.00 am with a chopper warming up for take off! Hotel breakfast included,but when in rest.informed only for a limit of $20 value; for 3 people no less! Hotel on Dexter St side is looking old and run down. I think some sort of refurbishment is underway thou. I doubt if I would choose this HI again.

Reviews.Title: “Go Fish”
Reviews.Author: Mac_Maximum
Reviews.Content: First of all, online the website says there is 1 hotel at this address. Once you enter the area, it seems there is only 1 property, but there are 2. The second being a standard Holiday Inn. The parking garage is a nightmare, located under each respective building, 1 is locked (holiday inn express), the second is open (holiday inn). They are separated by about 30 foot alley way. If you have the unlucky assignment of entering a garage on accident, due to pushy traffic behind, or no parking spots then you are really hosed. You have to drive backwards (in the HIE) parking garage lot up a huge incline, hoping not to have an auto swing around the sharp wall. The bar "the emerald" seemed okay, except it was happy hour and beers were still 4 bucks a pull. Not exactly a happy price...thanks but no thanks. I'll happily pay an extra buck or two and be where the crowds are more happening. I eventually stayed at the HIE property, the room was dreary, the view was an alley with the possibility of looking into a HI room (how exciting). The bathroom was really cramped. The TV was new flat screen (32 or 37 inch), which alone added a bubble point above. Will I come back, umm.. no. Given I still dropped with taxes over 140 bucks on a weekday, I'd drop an additional 50 to stay somewhere nice, with a view and close to the piers. I did not have the free breakfast, upon review the room looked way cramped for the number served. And after eating multiple HIE breakfasts, I couldn't bare to fight for a free piece of toast. How would I improve? 1. New Carpets 2. New Lobby 3. New Beds 4. Upgrade HVAC 5. Give an option to have a alley view or not. 6. New Elevators (really old looking used here)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, limited service”
Reviews.Author: Kit G
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days. Location was very convenient, but our room was smaller than most other HIEs and did not have a fridge or microwave. (I thought those were HIE standards!) The front staff said only "suites" have them. Breakfast was very good, though. We rented a car for one day to drive up to Anacortes so we had to pay for overnight parking for that night. We told the clerk for 1 night only and she repeated "just 1 night". When we got a checkout statement we were charged parking for 2 nights. We got 1 night parking off after we complained but that shouldn't have happened. If we weren't careful, we would have overlooked and got charged. Should have paid cash! Found out that it's a little closer to walk to catch the streetcar/trolley (than the monorail) to downtown and don't have to deal with stairs. ($2.50 but it's unlimited ride for 2 hours so you can ride back with the same ticket within 2 hrs) Also, Metro Light Rail takes you to SEATAC from downtown for $2.75 if you don't want to take a taxi and pay $60+

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: kuruchecha
Reviews.Content: i love the fact that this hotel has parking for $10. the location is great, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in comfort”
Reviews.Author: FrankT55
Reviews.Content: This was an unexpected find in Seattle. Close to the Space Needle. The room was spacious, the bed and sheets were heavenly (still trying to find where I can get those sheets). Clean place from top to bottom. Great warm pool. Great buffet breakfast with large variety, they change the menu every day. Don't expect a view, we were facing a wall, but then again wee were there to rest up for the next day sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “A Good HIE.”
Reviews.Author: travelin'gal77
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a quick trip via Amtrak to Seattle. I found the price was spot on, the location was very good. 15-20 minute walk to just about anything. $8 cab ride from the Amtrak station. The staff, especially Jason at the front desk, were incredible, giving plenty of suggestions where to go, what to see and where to eat. My room was clean, and yes the vanity was outside the bathroom, which honestly I like, so one person can shower and the other can still get ready. My only complaint is that on the 6th floor there are smoking rooms in the same hall as non smoking, but my room itself did not smell like smoke. A free breakfast in the morning is a nice way to get some coffee and some fruit into your belly before enjoying the day and all that Seattle has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ahorais
Reviews.Content: A popular spot for the pre and post cruise crowd. Close to downtown and the Needle. Most attractions about a 15 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Incredbile Staff, Good Value, Meidocre Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mmlc
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if there are some rooms that are updated, but the room that we were in certainly was not. The TV had to have been 15 years old, windows/decor outdated. And to top it off we had a lovely view of the alley and other rooms of the Holiday Inn behind it. The positive things are the nice breakfast, free WiFi, good location to Space Needle and the monorail, and incredible front desk staff. This was our first time in Seattle and had so many questions about the city. The staff went above and beyond every single time, helping us with transportation, tours, restaurants, and so many directions. Everyone I encountered at this hotel was friendly and helpful. The negative things were the SMALL bathrooms. The bathroom (toilet area) is the exact width of the door, making it awkward to change clothes or do anything in the bathroom with so little space. There was also mold at the top of the shower. The pool was very small with no hot tub. The elevators (two) were very slow, especially in the morning rush for breakfast/checking out. Overall I would definitely stay at this hotel again. We were able to get anywhere without a car, using the monorail and walking. We walked from the market, which wasn't so bad. When comparing the price to others in the area, this hotel was one of the cheapest, and had the best rooms. It's a value hotel, no frills, but a good place to come back to after a long day and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “solid experience all around ,though a bit crowded”
Reviews.Author: motownphillypvb
Reviews.Content: Decent location, we occupied two non-connecting rooms on the top floor, which we had requested, for three nights in May. One room faced a very busy street (some noise, even with window closed) but had great Space Needle views, while the other side of the building faces a narrow alley and the wall and windows of another hotel (as if the constant rain doesn't make it dark enough). Overall you get the HIE experience you'd expect, with the caveat that this hotel seems unusually crowded, i.e. too many rooms for its infrastructure. What do I mean by that?... The underground parking spaces are really small, and there simply isn't enough parking. If you were to come back to the hotel late, well enjoy street parking (or create parking spots in the garage out of thin air, which many people did!...). The wait at the two (!!) elevators seemed like an eternity. The line at breakfast went into the reception area each morning, but the breakfast was decent as usual at HIE. The pool was very busy as well. Once we got into our rooms, everything was clean and functional, so no complaints there. The bottom line: Yes, I would use that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill....”
Reviews.Author: Srgsx
Reviews.Content: Not what I expect from a holiday inn express. Vanity is in the main room which makes the use of it subject to others in the room, this is more of a la qunita type room than what I have seen from the express chain in general. The elevators here are beyond slow and the area in which they are in is a poorly designed congested spot near the pool entrance. The beds were cony but the frames felt like they could come apart at any moment and the four pillows were so used they seemed little more than functioning marshmallows. A convenient location with quiet rooms but with the above listed cons and a almost useless work out room, save your money and go next door to the holiday inn which we felt is in much better shape and a few bucks cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ZagFan89
Reviews.Content: On checkin we were upgraded to a 2 queen suite since I'm a priority club member and the room was available. For our 3 night stay that was very nice for our family of 4. The price is higher than what we usually pay for hotels but seemed comparable to those in the area. With the upgrade it seemed great! Breakfast is included and laid out in a manner that makes it fairly easy to obtain. Lots of choices to satisfy every family member. Location is only a few blocks away from Seattle Center and the free bus ride zone. Front desk was very helpful to us in figuring out busses to take to and from Qwest Field.

Reviews.Title: “Location is central”
Reviews.Author: govworker
Reviews.Content: A couple of blocks from Space Needle and downtown. Can walk to anywhere in city and pickup free downtown shuttle. Looks good on the outside but a little run down inside.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel, overpriced, but clean and functional”
Reviews.Author: cdd86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Hotel decor is tired and dated, needs a renovation.Good that it has free internet and complimentary breakfast (though choices inevitably bit limited). Hotel was clean and functional. But it's way overpriced, $229, should be $100 less. So might be OK if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: momof2inva
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed one night at this hotel before our Alaskan cruise. Check in was easy and staff friendly. The room was decent size but the bathroom very small. It was nice that the sink/mirror were just outside the bathroom to make getting ready a little faster for everyone. No problems with cleanliness but, our room could have used some updating. Space Needle, restaurants (we tried Zeek's pizza and it was great), and pharmacy were all within walking distance. We went to the pharmacy to get last minute items before cruising on Sat. morning. Youngest son and I swam in the indoor pool Sat. morning and it was small but clean and very warm! Breakfast was excellent...lots of choices but be patient as it was crowded almost all morning. It was well staffed with friendly folks. Independent shuttle came by for the cruise pier ($8 a person, previous poster reported $6 pp so maybe we got taken!). It was convenient and actually left before our scheduled time because we were all in the lobby and ready to go. No problems with our stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We really like it. We sure will be back”
Reviews.Author: Chemaria
Reviews.Content: Close to every mayor atraction, well located, very clean, the breakfast is includedin the price and the people at fron desk is very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and roomy”
Reviews.Author: YankeeFan06
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night here on the road trip north. This Holiday Inn is just a few blocks from the Space Needle/monorail and the Experience Music Project. Seattle is a small city, so downtown is just about a 15 minute walk. I felt safe even walking back from downtown after dinner. Hotel is on a busy street, but could not hear the noise. Our room had a great view of the Space Needle. Breakfast area was too small for the size of the hotel, had to hover for a table to open, but was well stocked. The hotel is busy during cruise season. There were a lot of guest staying a night to get on the ship the next day, so the lobby was busy in the morning. The one bedroom suite was roomy, with two full bathrooms. Had an issue with the toilet when we arrived, but someone came up immediately to fix it. There is a $10 daily parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “"Think twice before you book this hotel"”
Reviews.Author: sharongmd
Reviews.Content: Management was extremly arrogant. The room smelled as if someone chain smoked in it and when asked to more room, managment said we could not. They offered to clean the room with an ozone machine which actually made the room worse. We had to leave the room for several hours while the cleaning took place. I asked to speak to the hotel manager who was unavailable and when she called, she called the room while we were getting it cleaned and left a message right before she left for the day when she was given my cell phone number. I have never encountered such poor customer service at any establishment before. All of their front desk employees would benefit from going to a Customer Service class.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and (mostly) comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Laurajoys
Reviews.Content: I don't give 5s unless things were exceptional... That said, this was nice place, centrally located. All of the staff was helpful and efficient. Breakfast was good and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: runab0ut
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on the 4th floor before going on a cruise. Beautiful view of the Space Needle where we walked tthe next day. Friendly staff and ok breakfast. Used Seattle Best Car Service from airport to hotel then to pier then back to airport for a package price. Good deal!

Reviews.Title: “This place SUCKS!”
Reviews.Author: marescmm
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here for my daughter's bday. We did a lot of sightseeing and had so much fun in Seattle. The hotel however, was the only bad part about our weekend. We checked in on Friday night which was very busy(expectedly). The front staff was friendly. Our room was located right off of the elevators and ice machines. Although we were close to the foot traffic of that floor, the first night was ok. The room was clean and the size wasn't too bad. I got over the shock of no fridge or microwave. The second night was bad!!! The had a party going on in the room next to us and it was LOUD! This was an ajoining room, meaning that the wall diving our room had a large door in it. The sound just traveled right through it. I was very patient for about an hour at 2am. Finally at 3, I called the front desk and politely explained. They did nothing. My neighbors decided to move some of the party to the hallway and in front of my room. I gave it another 20 minutes and I was getting upset. I told the front desk that I was concerned that my children would wakeup. About 5 minutes later, a security gaurd came up and told them that he had a complaint and proceeded to tell them that people complain all the time about nothing and shaked their hands and left while the drunk guys were still out in the hallway(and in front of my room). About 10 minutes later, it gets really loud and (of course) they wokeup my kids. I was so pissed that the hotel was doing NOTHING. I peeked my head out of the door and asked them to please take it somewhere else because my kids had been woken up. They were apologetic and after a couple of minutes left the hallway and their room. I told the staff in the morning and they took off my parking charges for the 2 days($20). We will not be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Near the Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: AnnapGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Everything you expect from a Holiday Inn Express. Once we arrived, we didn't need the car for town. A nice 15-minute walk to the Space Needle. The monorail leaves the Space Needle and heads to Westlake Center, where you can pick up the light rail that goes through town. We used it without problem to see a show at the football stadium. Parking ($10 per night) at the hotel was packed, with security telling us to parked in unmarked spaces underground. Our room had a great view of the Space Needle, as the building faces this tourist attraction broadside, so I imagine that half of the rooms share a great view. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and stocked. TV was a flat screen with basic cable. Enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Orlblfan
Reviews.Content: What a nice little hotel for a terrific price! We stayed here for a couple of nights after returning from a cruise. The rooms were nice and the front desk staff was very helpful. It is only a short walk to the Space Needle. They have a nice breakfast buffet included. We arrived early and our rooms were ready and they let us check in, it was nice to get a little settled before heading out. The front desk staff was top notch, will help you with planning to get where you need to be. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Plus, free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend”
Reviews.Author: StPete_FLMark
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in May prior to leaving on an Alaskan cruise. Check in was easy, the staff was friendly. Our room was on the 5th floor with a terrific view of the Space Needle. The hotel was within easy walking distance to the Space Needle and the monorail. There is a restaurant in the Holiday Inn next door and a Whole Foods about 3 blocks away. The complimentary breakfast had the standard fare. Overall we had a great stay and would absolutely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Hobbitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend of April 29. Room was clean and quiet. You do have to pay $10/day parking, however, anywhere you go in Seattle you have to pay for parking and it's approximately $6 for 0 - 30 minutes, so you're better off to park at the hotel and walk or take transit whenever possible. It was easy walking distance to our event at Key Arena, and felt perfectly safe walking back at 10:30 pm. I did forget my computer mouse in our room and emailed the hotel. Jisoo the Executive Housekeeper replied saying they had found my mouse, which I'm very happy about! Shipping it is a 1/4 of the price of buying a new one! I would stay here again, but I would try for a room that is not facing Aurora Ave. first. It's a very busy street and at times can get loud with the traffic, especially if it's raining. Last, but not least, we stayed in a smoking room. If you need a smoking room you're going to have a hard time finding one somewhere else in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Metwo3
Reviews.Content: I'm one of those people looking for hotels that are "clean and safe" at a reasonable price. HIE fit the bill. It is located on a busy street (traffic noise except 2-5am) about 15-20 minute walk from the Space Needle, waterfront, and Westlake along streets with other hotels, apartments, parking lots. So not in the heart of tourist sites. Few pedestrians at night. Bus stops about 2 blocks away. Taxis cost $6-12 to downtown destinations. Parking as mentioned before. We had the 2Q bed, 2 bath suite. The bedroom was large enough with vanity in room. Second full bath at entrance to living room. Living room had door to separate from bedroom and contained couch, coffee table, small table with chair, TV. Microwave, frig, and sink near door. Stain on living room carpeting. Rest of rooms seemed clean. We had one mechanical problem that was repaired the day we reported it. Maid replaced towels despite our hanging them up each day. She missed our room one day, but I think it may be because part of our party checked out. Room did have an odor, so we opened the windows each day while we were out. Traffic noise was loud to me so I ran the fan and wore ear plugs. Staff was extremely helpful with the reservation, check in/out, area questions, etc. One person seemed to be in training and needed some work to understand urgency of guest requests, but I think she'll get there under the guidance of the rest of the staff. Pool was tiny (did not use). Exercise room basic (did not use). Breakfast room seated 60 with some variation in the hot food each day. I thought it was generous. Free wifi and two computers/printers in a small room. A friend got a snack/drink at the adjacent HI and said it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a quick trip”
Reviews.Author: BcAtHome
Reviews.Content: The location is good - right by the Space Needle. We walked to it both days and had a lovely time. I liked not having to drive and pay for parking. The parking was pretty full and we had to wait for someone to leave but it didn't take long. The rooms were spacious - we had a bedroom with a separate sitting room and a sleeper sofa. The breakfast was fine - standard cont. breakfast but there was not enough seating. It was fine for the price and the quick trip to see the Harry Potter Exhibit at the Science Center. The pool is very small but the kids still loved it.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: ylu4
Reviews.Content: They have almost everything we need, such as clean rooms, good breakfast. Staffs are friendly and helpful. Got a great deal from hotwire, which is under 70 a night. The 2 queen bed room doesn't have a view, but is quieter and has better/newer beds. The King bed (mini?) suite is a little bit larger and with a view of space needle which is awesome but facing the highway with tolerable noise level. The breakfast room staffs are really nice; they always give our kids cookies when we got into the breakfast room with a smile. Overall, a great stay and happy experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: houstonguy2010
Reviews.Content: Check in was ok with no problems. The room was clean and neat. There was an air purifier on the ceiling in the hallway that made a electrical crackling sound each time we walked under it that scared my 8 year old. Maid service was spotty at best. The breakfast was ok in the mornings but at times no place to sit. Check out was not good at all. We had a $42.00 refund due and I stood at the front desk for 20 minutes waiting for the clerk to complete the refund. Our cab was waiting and I was told I had to sign something. The general manager came over and even then the clerk could not figure out the way to check me out. I had to leave as our train was getting ready to leave soon. I do not advise walking at night with small children in this area. It is close to the Space Needle. About a 15 minute walk. I would not stay here again due to location and service issues.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shahzadeh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my best friend. We arrived at the hotel very early (around noon) and were surprised to find that our rooms were ready and that we could check in. Our room was very clean and comfortable. I loved the pillows!!!!!! The location was great, too. We had breakfast at the restaurant next door and it was pretty good. The portions were huge, though, which meant that neither of us could finish our meals. Staff were friendly and helpful. The town car driver gave us dirty looks every time we saw him because we told him we were not interested in his services (he asked us about 2-3 times and each time, we said no. We only took licensed taxis).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay!”
Reviews.Author: smiles111
Reviews.Content: We recently had a 1 night stay on our quick tourist trip to Seattle! We found it to be awesome value at $78/Night with Free breakfast which was plentiful and a good selection of food! The rooms were exceptionally clean and I think it would have to be one of my best nights sleep in the most comfortable bed. The room is a studio size so its good for short stays only, it would have been useful to hav a mini fridge and maybe a basin for the bathroom would have been better. We walked to everything we needed to go the location was great and the front desk staff were happy to advise on all the attractions and questions that we had! I would reccomend this hotel for any traveller to seattle, great spot to rest up after a long day out sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Great for its price!”
Reviews.Author: travelgal36064
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came down from BC to do a little shopping, and wanted a cheap but decent hotel to stay at. This was perfect. We had booked a single room with a king bed, but we were upgraded to a suite for free: king bed AND jacuzzi tub. The view of the space needle was amazing, and the service was excellent. I was skeptical about paying $85 a night, with a free breakfast, but the breakfast was to die for! All really hot and always being replenished- a plus compared to some places where it's more of a first come first serve thing. The staff are incredibly friendly, and helped recommend some great eats closeby. Best place to stay if you aren't wanting to spend great amounts of money for a great hotel! Oh, and the concierge gave us free parking for the weekend too, bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Stole $205!”
Reviews.Author: WAtraveler2k
Reviews.Content: This is the absolute work stay in any hotel. The reservation was booked and PAID for over a month in advance. We spent our weekend there and left. Found a second charge of $205 for the same room we had paid for a month previous on the day we departed. When asked to refund the money the customer service of this hotel replied "we can't find the money we took before, so I had to come out again." We sent bank statements showing the withdrawal of the funds, we had our bank representative call and talk with customer service with absolutely NOTHING done to refund the $205. Next is the attorney and more fun. Avoid this place like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Capikat
Reviews.Content: When we checked in Jeff put us in his "favorite" room (614), it was a corner room on the 6th floor with a great view of the Space Needle and EMP. Nice, spacious, very clean room, tiny bathroom though. We were in walking distance of the Seattle Center where we enjoyed going to EMP/Science Fiction Museum and the Harry Potter Experience at the Pacific Science Center. Breakfast was good, but it was busy so the staff didn't have a lot of time to clean tables in between guests. Saw one breakfast person put new bacon on top of the old bacon in the warmer which is great for people to get fresh bacon except for the people that come in toward the end of breakfast then who knows how old the bacon left is. But besides that it was a good breakfast. Chad was great when we checked out that morning and looked up my Priority Club number so I could get my points. Over all my husband and I had a great time exploring the Seattle Center and relaxing in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Long Johns”
Reviews.Author: ldp60802
Reviews.Content: After arriving to an unheated room I was told by the front desk that for energy conservation purposes rooms were not heated until the guests turned the heater on. With a snow storm outside, the room was actually pretty cold. After some "negotiations" the maintenance did check the heater, which was in order, and the room was also warm in the morning when I left. One should value new experiences, I guess, and sleeping with the overcoat on was new to me.

Reviews.Title: “Clean spacious room with decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jerraine
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with extended family, with young kids. The room was spacious. The bathroom was clean. Breakfast was decent. The breakfast room has two attendants at all time, so the food was always well stocked. The location of the hotel was great. We walked to the Space Needle. There's also a Walgreens close by, so it was very convenience. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, close to everything, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: hawksfansince1976
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express is affordable (when compared to other downtown Seattle motels-hotels) and within walking distance to downtown attractions and has a covered parking garage at an affordable price. You are also within a very short walk to the free zone for the downtown busses. The room was clean and comfortable and everything worked fine with no problems. The pool was heated nicely and the work out room was basic but a bit "cramped". The breakfast (included hot and ready) was tasty and had the usual items but was well stocked and attended. Staff was friendly and very helpful and check in and out was fast and efficient with no problems encountered of any kind.

Reviews.Title: “Basic no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: violet559
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for Seattle weekend trip with my husband. Pretty good location - can walk to Seattle city center (eg: Space Needle) easily. The bus stop across the street will take you downtown (Bus # 358). Room was average.....got woken up by garbage truck early each morning. First morning there was no hot water for a shower (boiler problem)....but was fixed promptly. Bed was not that comfortable. Breakfast was average and basic (eggs, yogurt, cereals, toast, etc). If you just need a basic room to explore the Seattle downtown area from, this hotel is 'ok'. No rants, no raves either.. We booked this hotel on Hotwire ($67 plus fees and taxes)...so I didnâ€™t chose this hotel specifically. There are probably better 3* hotels in Seattle, but this is the one we ended up with on Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: srm1977
Reviews.Content: We were dropped off by the taxi at the holiday inn. This backs on to the holiday inn express and is accessible through a door in reception. Not sure why they have 2 hotels for the same company on one site. Makes it confusing. Anyway we checked in and the front desk staff was very happy and helpful. Room was a basic American hotel. The toilet got blocked in the morning but we were there only 1 night so was not much of a problem as it could have been. All in all your basic hotel

Reviews.Title: “Space Needle right outside our window can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: JGallagher28
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two teenagers and we rented the queen 2 room suite. The rooms were clean, spacious, fun for the kids, and I was pleasantly surprised when using the sofa bed. I had anticipated it would not be comfortable, but my nephew slept well, and it worked out great! Jeff at the front desk was a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible ... expensive and smelly. I just cannot understand why they have smoking rooms”
Reviews.Author: mahiwahoo
Reviews.Content: My in-laws were staying at this hotel. They had already booked through their travel agent in Australia (obviously now in hindsight the Aussie travel agent did not have a clue). We were meeting up with my in-laws in Seattle and decided to stay in the same hotel. Ours was a last minute booking directly with Holiday Inn so we ended up with the only room available...a smoking room. My wife and I are both non-smokers. It was a choice between causing massive uproar with my wife, or, putting up and shutting up for one night in the filthy stinky smokers room. Breakfast was tasteless plastic scrambled eggs. What a horrible experience and a lesson well learnt....don't travel with in-laws! The good thing I did like about this hotel is their coin operated laundry facilities which came in very handy to rid my clothes of the smoke smell. As an alternative to Holiday Inn Express, I highly recommend the Ramada if you're looking for a hotel in the same vicinity. Ramada is better priced and above par as compared to Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “Double charged me instead of my company once!! HORABLE SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: kmberlee386
Reviews.Content: Save your money and stay at the Quality Inn! Would have the same service for much lower costs. My company upgraded our hotel so we may stay more comfortably but instead ended up having rude employees and they charged my personal debit card instead of my company card. And for only staying one night, they charged my card twice!! Had to go through the bank to get corrected because every time I would call I would get put on hold for up to 45 minutes then mysteriously disconnected. Not trustworthy, do NOT give them your pesonal information unless you want them charging you falsely. I will NEVER stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for Seattle sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: TexBecks
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because we mostly needed a clean place to eat and sleep, since our days were filled with sight-seeing. This hotel did not disappoint, and the overall price was nearly $100 less than what we were seeing for other hotels in the same neighborhood. Our room had a nice view of the Space Needle. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and we especially appreciated the free breakfast and free Wi-Fi. The location was fine for us, because we didn't mind walking a few blocks to downtown. It's 2 blocks from Whole Foods in one direction, and 2 blocks from a Walgreens in the other direction. Seattle dining tends to be expensive, so we appreciated being able to grab dinner from Whole Foods and take it back to our hotel. There's a key-accessible underground parking garage with plenty of parking, and we felt much better about leaving our rental car there instead of in a surface lot. Good hotel for travelers who need a comfortable place to sleep and clean up.

Reviews.Title: “The Space Needle was right outside the window”
Reviews.Author: bilz
Reviews.Content: The hotel's selling point, the Space Needle, is only a few blocks away and it was visible right outside of our room window. It's only a short walk away, maybe 5-10 minutes, and the walk felt very safe at 8 or 9 pm. Pike Place Market, Seattle aquarium, and downtown were a 15-30 minute walk but again, felt very safe and I would fully recommend the walk as I don't know how easy downtown parking is. Overall, this hotel has everything you come to expect from Holiday inn Express. Parking would be my only complaint about this location. Apparently space is at a premium here and the garage is underneath the hotel down a somewhat difficult to navigate ramp. There is no temporary check-in parking so the breezeway that you drive through to access the parking garage is often blocked by parked cars or taxis. Only a minor inconvenience and it won't keep me from staying here again next time I visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for us”
Reviews.Author: Dusty Ranger
Reviews.Content: stayed four nights end of July, first of August. bed was soft enough, A/C works and kept road noise to an acceptable level. Breakfast was good enough. You can eat healthy, or get some sausage and eggs. They lose two points for coffee grounds in their very industrial coffee. The Guatemalan help couldn't work the coffee maker all for days. they lose another point for not having angled parking slots in the $10/nite parking. They may sell more parking passes than they have slots. I thought the front desk was accommodating, when treated with respect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: Coastal_Plainer
Reviews.Content: This is your good old dare I say it without disrespect bog standard HIX and so you know what you are going to get. We had booked using Priority Points and were very lucky to get a parking space at the front of the building. We were given a room on the top floor (621) which had two large double beds which were good for us all, a flat screened television, and breakfast is included. We also accessed the internet using the wireless capability and it was a little slow at times but otherwise was fine for general work. The complementary newspaper was useful to get up to speed on what was happening in the city and around. The breakfast area was indeed very full and we were a little lucky to get a table on both mornings that we were there. However, the breakfast time availability was extended time and it did get quieter a little later. Cereals, fruit, toast, muffins as well as eggs etc were available and milk was available in cartons which you took to your table. A variety of fruit juices and coffee was also available. There was a large sofa with a large screened television also in this room to keep the children occupied when they did not want to sit at the table. Another plus with this hotel was the swimming pool itself which was great for the children. The only real downside was a lack of changing facilities and there only being one shower (all this is shared with the fitness room next door) so there was a wait and a quick change before heading back to the room. The room we were in was not on the Space needle side of the hotel and even on the top floor the noise of the bins being cleared was evident during the early morning. Also this floor is higher than the HI next door so you do get a good view towards the east side of the city and I5. The location is extremely good for a relatively short walk to the Needle and it was not bad for a walk into the basic shopping centre of the city itself. This was evident with our two young children and we actually used the reasonably priced monorail back to the Needle to come back. The general area around the hotel is a little run down but it is clear that it is being improved with new apartments and leisure spaces including restaurants between the hotel and the Needle. In conclusion this is a good value oriented hotel for visiting the Needle and the city centre. As we were tourists using our car to get to places was not really required, we used a "tour" to do this (if you want a little fun and have kids check out the Ducks). In hindsight we would have liked to have stayed in Seattle longer and this hotel fitted the bill very well.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay here, its OK, but there are better places around Seattle”
Reviews.Author: kermitt73
Reviews.Content: I was climbing Mount Rainier with a friend and reservations before and after the climb. My thoughts were we could leave our luggage at the hotel while we were on the mountain and pick it up when we checked in after our climb. They refused to do this for us. We were told they did not have enough room to store our luggage. However, they do have enough room to store the luggage of the people departing and returning for cruises out of Seattle. That really irritated me. I stayed there on points and if it was not for that I would opt for somewhere else. It is very close to the Seattle Center, but you are 15-20 minute walk from the Pike Place Market. The shuttle that they recommended we use was 15 minutes late and caused us to be late for a mandatory meeting. Additionally, the shuttle cost twice as much as the Orange Cab service. The hotel is clean, although a little outdated. Don't expect a flatscreen TV. The free breakfast is good, but it was full every time we went down there so don't count on getting a seat. I guess it was from all of the cruise patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Awkward location and room design”
Reviews.Author: Lori24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly clean and beds were comfortable. Staff was helpful and friendly. However, the location is literally steps from a huge busy highway with barracades separating the hotel from the walk to the Space Needle. So, be prepared to walk a couple of extra blocks to get around the barracaded highway. Also, the room was designed with the sink area out in the room - separate from the bathroom. This was awkward, and just plain yucky-- unless you are staying alone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Excellant Service, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: hmck
Reviews.Content: Always first class service at this hotel. The location is convenient to downton Seattle. The beds are comfortable and clean. If you turn the fan on on the air conditioner, you get white noise so that you cannot hear the traffic on Aurora. The one downside is the flow restrictors in the sinks. Sometimes it takes 5 minutes to get hot water and then it isn't much. The shower is fine though.

Reviews.Title: “Good view of space needle, excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: L_traveller101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on holiday. Location is good for space needle but not so good for downtown Seattle (still only 20minute ish walk to tourist attractions). Front deak very helpful. Two computers to use and free printing. Good breakfast in the morning and very spacious room.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle Visit”
Reviews.Author: Dave127
Reviews.Content: Visited Seattle from 06-5-10 to 06-08-10. The location of the hotel to Seattle Center and downtown was perfect. It is a short five minute walk to Seattle Center for the Space Needle, Pacific Science Center and the monorail. I have no complaints about the hotel. We had no trouble with the hotel being noisy, but we were no facing the street. The breakfast in the morning was perfect way to start your day. There is a Whole Foods Market within walking distance. If I were in Seattle again I would stay at the Holiday Inn Express City Center.

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wwhog
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with our 2 young children (2 and 5). I was looking for a hotel in DT Seattle with free breakfast, a pool and under $150. This one has all of that + free wireless internet. It was all I expect from a quality "budget" hotel: clean no-frills rooms and good service. The pool was warm but the adjoining weight room (where the washrooms are) is freezing and you need your key to get back to the pool! don't get locked out like we did... And I wish the shallow end were shallow (it's 4 feet), this one's not little kids-friendly. The breakfast (which is included) is basic but plentiful and the service staff is excellent. Parking is $10 a night which I think is excessive. Really, who walks to that hotel? it's a bit of a way to grab extra cash while posting a lower nightly rate. Overall a pleasant stay for us. We will use that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jenyasha
Reviews.Content: Who: young couple with a 10 month old baby When: March 2010 Pros: The room was spacious, clean and stocked with goodies. GREAT continental breakfast (they even had scrambled eggs!) In the The Emerald Green restaurant food was average, but it was quiet, cozy & very baby friendly. Pool & excercise room. Location very close to downtown & Seattle Needle. Cons: Location area was a bit sketchy, especially in the evening. Hotel is outdated. We had the slowest coffee maker I've ever seen in my life. Would we come back? Yes

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel except for smoking policy”
Reviews.Author: working4food
Reviews.Content: The stay was good except for the mixture of smoking and non smoking on the same floor. I could have lived without waking up to the smell of cigarette smoke coming from another room on the same floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: AbenaOhene
Reviews.Content: Reasons for staying at the HI Express: (1) our friends were staying at the regular Holiday Inn across the lane but we opted for the HI Express instead because they had a pool for the kids. (2) It's close to the Space Needle/Seattle Center where we were going on one of our two days in town. (3) Breakfast is included with the hotel price, (4) parking is only $10/night and (5) there's free Internet. Finally, (6) the staff were great. The downsides are: (1) the pool is tiny (but the kids didn't care). (2) It's right beside Hwy 101 so not a scenic location. (3) Strange room layout for "2 Queen Beds" room -- the bathroom sink is in the main entryway rather than in the bathroom. Recommended as a quick, no-frills stay for families with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, cheap parking and close to Seattle Down Town”
Reviews.Author: KirstineDenmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here. The view and location isn't that good, but the decor and size of the room is good. We chose the hotel because of the cheap parking and we would be able to walk into the center. I think the hotel is good value. The breakfast is also fine - better compared to many motels.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: plevi1
Reviews.Content: I don't know if this is good value for money because I paid for it with priceline - but I want to recomend this place. The only downside of this place is the roar of traffic from Aurora St - so bring earplugs. Otherwise it is a decent place with a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in city center”
Reviews.Author: wguterbock
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a large, 5-story, 60s era Holiday Inn that has been rebranded as an HI Express. It is close to Seattle Center (Space Needle, Rock and Roll Museum) and sits right on Aurora Ave., a major North-South artery, so there is traffic noise. I did not explore the neighborhood but it did not look inviting for walkers or like there was much of interest within walking distance. As of Feb 2010 it has not yet gotten the full remodeling treatment that other Express hotels have and the interiors still have the old HI decor. My single king room was large and clean. Bed was comfortable and had a choice of firm and soft pillows. Lots of towels. Free internet and breakfast but no microwave or fridge, unlike other Express hotels I have recently stayed in. Parking is $10/night. The breakfast was the usual HIE selection of cereals, overcooked eggs, biscuits and gravy, pastries, and breads. The fitness room had five cardio machines but no strength training equipment at all. There is a small indoor pool. The hotel has a basic, utilitarian feel but represents very good value in a central location in a major city. Nothing fancy but it has everything you need for a comfortable overnight stay (except a weight machine in the gym).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy_Jayzzz
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'd like to thank Chad for making it hassle free to refund a double charge that was wrongly made to my cc....just one phone call and one email. That is truly excellent after sales service! Hotel location is quite near the space needle. However, if it was raining (which it was when we arrived) I'd advise against going to the needle as you can't really see anything from up there....$$ wasted. The area looks pretty safe. We walked around the night with kids and didn't feel insecure (unlike in LA). Parking was in a locked garage which opens when you insert the room key...took me a while to figure that out :{, but it was cool. Elevator in the garage goes straight to the room, which was excellent cos we've got lots of luggage with all the shopping at the premium outlet. Of course you'd have to go to the right garage to get to the right wing...we just happened to go into the correct one. There's a Walgreen's nearby which made it convenient to buy supplies. We had a room facing a wall, which was very quiet. No scenery from there. Rented a car from Avis, and they have a service to drive us from the hotel to Avis nearby, which was nice. Breakfast is a nice addition...enough to get us all going for the day. All in all, an excellent place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jsguyrus
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times for business and I find it to be an excellent hotel. Most of the rooms have been updated and many have a beautiful view of the Space Needle. It is located on the North end of downtown, within walking distance of the many belltown restaurants. The prices tend to vary a lot and can become quite expenisve in the summer. I would tend to shop around during the height of the summer tourist season. About the only downside is the wi-fi system which can be very slow at times. Also as an FYI parking is $10 per night, which isn't bad in a downtown area hotel. Overall it is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, clean, comfortable, safe, reasonable priced”
Reviews.Author: hmck
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptionable Holiday Inn Express. I have stayed at others that were ok. Here the staff really goes out of their way to make the stay pleasent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: BigBabySurrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to our flight out of Seatac Airport. Room was clean and quiet and we didn't have any issues with checking-in/out. Liked the king size bed so that my husband, son, and I were able to co-sleep. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: pnut598
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean hotel and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I thought the room price was very reasonable for it's location. We had a suite on the top floor that looked directly at the space needle. The parking was very secure with easy access, even though you had to pay $10 a night it was worth it. You are within walking distance of some many attractions we left the car parked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice For the price”
Reviews.Author: kdr48
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel..good continental breakfast...parking should be free, but I guess Seattle is expensive for cars. No frills close to Space Needle and monorail to downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Holidaytravelfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Express for 1 night on my way to Oregon. The hotel is easily accessible from the highway. Rooms are solid, nothing special but clean and comfortable. A great feature is the free hot breakfast. Parking is underground and $10.00 a day. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lblazekdsgnr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pleasant, clean, and roomy. Very comfortable. Location was 15 minute walk from the Monorail which takes you to the heart of Downtown (10 minute walk to Pikes Place Market) in minutes for only $2 per person. We left our car in the free parking and used this transportation exclusively for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a little overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: brizzyguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right near the space needle, and if you are lucky enough to get an Aurora Ave facing room, will have a good view of it. It is so close, you can walk there and you can also catch the Monorail to downtown for a few bucks. The hotel is quite nice, I had a room on the top floor, which had cathedral ceilings. The beds/pillows were clean and comfortable. Free Internet, good tv selection, reasonable bathroom. The rooms felt dated, but I am not sure if this is normal in Seattle for this price range? The location is OK, and I like how Seattle lets you ride the downtown buses for free. There is a new light rail connection from SEA-TAC to Downtown, but the missing link at Tukwila will only be completed later this year. At present, you have to switch to a bus at Tukwila to complete that last section to SEA-TAC. There is also a 194 bus from SEA-TAC that goes all the way to Downtown for just $1.75. From Downtown, it was a $6 cab ride to this hotel. This hotel was nice, but if you want something a bit cheaper, the Mediterranean Inn a short distance away is also a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: suprhoney
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay in Seattle and after reading the reviews on this site, decided to book the HI Express Downtown. We had planned this trip for our anniversary and wanted to experience "Teatro Zinzanni" again (previously visited on a trip to San Francisco a few years ago). The rooms are clean and bright, the air conditioning works perfect without being too noisy, the free breakfast buffet is awesome with lots of variety, including fresh hot srambled eggs, fruit, yogurt etc. The bed was very comfortable with 2 pillows each, one "firm" and one "soft", as marked on the covers. Pool and gym were clean and not crowded. The hotel's own bar/restaurant offers 2 Happy Hours, one early and one late with great specials. Not too far to walk to the Space Needle and Pike Place Market. Overall, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Holiday Inn Express, but not for light sleepers...”
Reviews.Author: London_Andy
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 1 baby) stayed here for a week and found things to be generally fine. I had booked a room at the back of the hotel given that the road at the front is really busy â€“ the downside of this is that you get a view of the Holiday Inn on the other side of the alley out the back, rather than the Space Needle, but this isnâ€™t such a big deal. However, as mentioned by others, there seem to be trucks going down the road at the back of the hotel in the early hours of the morning which woke us up a couple of times. I would describe the location of the hotel as being just beyond the edge of downtown â€“ it is close to the Seattle Centre/Space Needle and quite easy to walk into the city centre in about 20 minutes and it isnâ€™t far from the edge of the â€œfree rideâ€� bus zone. A tip for others staying here is that the route 99 bus is free all day (not just peak hours) and is also free along the length of its route rather than just in the â€œfree rideâ€� area â€“ it goes past many of the sights and isnâ€™t too long a walk from the hotel. The taxi ride from the airport cost about $45 and the check-in was quick and easy (even got some water and cookies for being a Priority Club member!). The hotel is quite modern, and we had a one bedroom suite (with a completely separate bedroom) which was fine for our needs as it allowed us to be in one room and the baby to sleep in the other. The bed was comfortable and the bedroom was clean. It was also great that free wifi was available. The only downside was that the kitchenette wasnâ€™t really sufficient to prepare any food for our baby â€“ there were no utensils provided beyond plastic knives/forks/plates, although the fridge came in handy for storing her food. Talking of food, the breakfast buffet was the standard Holiday Inn Express fare, which I happen to like! It was good that fruit was provided as well as the less healthy options. The breakfast room is quite small given the size of the hotel, but although it was always busy we never had to wait. The staff there did a great job in ensuring that everything was kept stocked. We chose the Holiday Inn Express rather than the Holiday Inn next door as the Express had a swimming pool â€“ we ended up only using this once (too much to see in Seattle!) but it was a great facility to have and the temperature was lovely. We got a great rate of $140 per night through the Intercontinental â€œFriends and Familyâ€� scheme as one of my friends works for them in the UK â€“ if you know someone who works for the hotel chain you get a good discount (I shouldnâ€™t say that you could google â€œintercontinental hotels friends and familyâ€� but.....) Car parking is an extra $10 per night, but we only picked up the rental car towards the end of our stay from the nearby Avis given how easy it is to get around Seattle on foot/by public transport. We had read about the problems using the underground carpark so we parked at street level â€“ there seemed to be a few spare spaces. The restaurant in the Holiday Inn (Emerald Grill) wasnâ€™t so good â€“ we tried it once as Priority Club members get a discount. We stood there for 5 minutes as 3 staff walked by without even acknowledging that we were standing there. When we sat down we werenâ€™t given menus and were given a broken baby seat. The food was mediocre on top of this, so I wouldnâ€™t recommend the restaurant. All in all we would definitely consider staying there if we visited Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the flying garbage cans at 2am!”
Reviews.Author: CraigAWashDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the service was fine. We were happy with our stay, until the garbage trucks started throwing the dumpsters around at 2am. That continued for 15 minutes and woke us up solidly. Then the garbage trucks came back again around 5am to repeat with a different set of cans. My family and I were all dazed in the morning - not even Starbucks could save the next day for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMorrison
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express Seattle City Center is just a few blocks away from downtown and the Seattle Center (Space Needle). It's within easy walking distance of the Needle (maybe 6 blocks) and near good public transportation that can get you easily around to tourist sights in central Seattle. We spent 2 nights here. The hotel is modern and the rooms were clean and everything worked OK. No complaints. Our room fronted busy Aurora Avenue which can get a little noisy, so if you are sensitive to noise ask for a room in the back. On the other hand, we had a very nice view of the Space Needle. The breakfast buffet was up to Holiday Inn Express standards, a big selection that fills you up well into the afternoon. However it got a little crowded in the breakfast room at peak times, we had to wait for a table one morning. I didn't realize until we checked out that there are actually TWO hotels here - the HI Express and a "full service" Holiday Inn right next door (I thought it was just one hotel!) If you don't mind staying a little ways from downrtown (it's just a few blocks!) or want to be near the Space Needle, you can't beat this hotel! We paid about $150/night for very nice rooms in summer season!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it very much!”
Reviews.Author: TheHils
Reviews.Content: Space needle was a walk away. Enjoyed it at night especially. Area of hotel was safe and nice to walk around in the evening. Airport was far but the bus transportation was easy to arrange. Overall, it was great. I loved Seattle and I would love to visit again and stay at the same hotel... Staff was good. Place was clean. It wasnt the best or a five-star stay but it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, Good location.”
Reviews.Author: SummerFamilyTravel
Reviews.Content: Average pricing with great customer service and convenient location. The rooms and beds were very comfortable. The 10 minute walk to Seattle Center was easy for a family with older children. The free breakfast had extensive choices that even included eggs. $10/night parking was a better deal than most hotels in the same area and definately cheaper than hourly parking. We didn't try the pool as we were too busy with all the other attractions at Seattle Center and downtown. The City Pass is a good deal for those who are planning 3 or more of the activities included. (Science Center, IMAX, EMP/SciFi Museum, Flight Museum, Aquarium, Harbor Cruise, Zoo)

Reviews.Title: “Good value, space needle view, tight quarters”
Reviews.Author: nc6
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at this hotel, for a total of 6 people at the Seattle city Center HI Express. We enjoyed the typical HI express amenities which include triple-sheeted beds, comfortable linens/towels, and free breakfast. One of our rooms was a "mini suite" which had one queen bed, a sofa with pull-out, coffee table, computer desk, microwave, and mini-fridge. It had a nice view of the space needle from the window (see photo). The other room was just a regular room with 2 Qs. Both rooms got good free in-room wifi which is always a plus when you are sightseeing. The location was excellent, just a few blocks walk to the "Seattle city center" area which has the space needle, pacific science center, emp/sci fi museum, and many restaurants. There is a monorail there that you can take to get within walking distance of the pike market, so overall you are pretty nicely situated to walk or use public transportation to numerous sights and restaurants. This HI Express backs up to a "regular" Holiday Inn and they share the same parking garage which was a bit tight to get into and around with our rental minivan, but we managed. The parking has a fee of $10 a day, but I don't think the hotel actually charged our account for that. The rooms at this hotel, like the parking, are tight. We had 2 younger children with us in the mini-suite and had requested a rollaway bed which was promptly provided. However, there was absolutely nowhere to put it in this small room! So we ended up putting one child on the unextended sofa, putting the coffee table on end in the closet area, and then opening the rollaway in the coffee table's normal space. We could barely get by without tripping over the rollaway bed, but I guess it is a small price to pay for not listening to kids kick each other during the night. We were not charged for the rollaway either. The breakfast was typical HI Express - there was 1 hot option each morning, scrambled eggs and bacon, or eggs with biscuits and gravy. There was a nice assortment of muffins (the chocolate-chocolate-chip scored well with my crowd) and cinnamon rolls. Also, cereal, yogurt, milk, juice, coffee, and apples or bananas. The hotel does have an on-site restaurant, which as priority club members we were given a 10% off coupon for, but we did not go since its reviews were nothing special. The people at the front desk were friendly and efficient. Although the rooms (and the parking) were tight, they met our needs and were clean and comfortable. There is a small indoor pool. We were pleased with getting this very reasonable, comfortable accommodation in the prime sight-seeing area of Seattle. If we had stayed longer, we might have gotten tired of stepping over each other, but as it was, we spent our days out and about and so it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good - Front Desk was excellent - Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Tennisbum42
Reviews.Content: Had a nice room that looked at the space needle - room was clean - good tv reception - flat screen - shower head was fantastic. Restaurant was very good on premise and breakfast was excellent - desk got us transportation to train and airport on two separate stays. We would recommend this hotel. j & e - Point Pleasant Beach, NJ

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mlfunnell
